intro: Brassica juncea subsp. eujuncea, commonly known as Chinese kale or kale, is a leafy green vegetable native to East Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its thick, dark green leaves and edible stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small yellow flowers in the spring. It is cultivated for its nutritional value, containing high levels of vitamins A, C, and K. This subspecies is well-suited to temperate climates and is often grown in home gardens and commercial agriculture.
